sen.j: 伏見宮貞清親王（ふしみのみや さだきよしんのう、慶長元年（1596年） - 承応3年7月4日 (旧暦)（1654年8月16日））は、江戸時代初期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadakiyo (1596 - August 16, 1654) was a member of the Imperial family during the early Edo period.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadakiyo (1596 - August 16, 1654) was a member of the Imperial family in the early Edo period.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadakiyo (1596 - August 16, 1654) was a member of the Imperial family in the early Edo period.
He was the tenth head of the Fushiminomiya family.
He was the tenth head of the Fushiminomiya family.
He was the tenth head of the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 伏見宮第9代当主伏見宮邦房親王第一王子。
sen.e: He was the first son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuninobu who was the ninth head of the Fushiminomiya family.
He was the first son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuninobu who was the ninth head of the Fushiminomiya family.
He was the first son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuninobu who was the ninth head of the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 側室に豊臣秀吉養女（宇喜多秀家の女）。
sen.e: His concubine was an adopted daughter of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI (a daughter of Hideie UKITA).
sen.cmt: ウィキペディアのサイトでは、「側室に前田利長養女」となっていました→http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BC%8F%E8%A6%8B%E5%AE%AE%E8%B2%9E%E6%B8%85%E8%A6%AA%E7%8E%8B
sen.e: One of his concubines was a daughter adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who was a woman from the family of Hideie UKITA.
sen.cmt: His concubine→One of his concubinesに, an adopted daughter of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI →a daughter adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMIに訂正しました。（宇喜多秀家の女)を訂正しました。
sen.e: One of his concubines was a daughter adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who was a daughter from the family of Hideie UKITA.
sen.cmt: 「～の女」は娘のことなので、daughterとしました。

sen.j: 慶長10年（1605年）に元服、親王宣下。
sen.e: In 1605, he experienced genpuku (celebration of one's coming of age) and was given the title of Imperial Prince.
In 1605, he experienced genpuku (a rite to mark the attainment of manhood) and was given the title of Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: celebration of one's coming of age→a rite to mark the attainment of manhood
sen.e: In 1605, he experienced genpuku (a coming-of-age celebration for boys) and was given the title of Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: a rite to mark the attainment of manhood→a coming-of-age celebration for boys(元服のファイルを参考にしました。）

sen.j: 王子女に、伏見宮邦尚親王、伏見宮邦道親王、伏見宮貞致親王、重慶親王、顕子女王（徳川家綱室）、照子女王（徳川光貞室）、梅子女王（久我広通室）など
sen.e: His children were Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuninari, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunimichi, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki, Prince 重慶, Princess Akiko (Ietsuna TOKUGAWA's wife), Princess Teruko (Mitsusada TOKUGAWA's wife), Princess 梅子 (Hiromichi KOGA's wife) and so on.
sen.cmt: 「邦尚」の読み→http://kotobank.jp/word/%E9%82%A6%E5%B0%9A%E8%A6%AA%E7%8E%8B「照子」の読み→http://kotobank.jp/word/%E7%85%A7%E5%AD%90%E5%A5%B3%E7%8E%8B「重慶」「梅子」の読み不明
sen.e: He had several children including Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuninari, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunimichi, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki, Prince 重慶, Princess Akiko (Ietsuna TOKUGAWA's wife), Princess Teruko (Mitsusada TOKUGAWA's wife) and Princess Umeko (Hiromichi KOGA's wife).

He had several children including Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuninari, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunimichi, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayuki, Prince 重慶, Princess Akiko (Ietsuna TOKUGAWA's wife), Princess Teruko (Mitsusada TOKUGAWA's wife) and Princess Umeko (Hiromichi KOGA's wife).
